page.title: 01Swyncombe/Cookley Green Area
page.content: Throughout history this area has been referred to as "The Deserts of Chiltern"; the most secluded and perhaps most beautiful part of the Chiltern HIlls. A section of the steep escarpment is at Howe Hill at the northern end of the area. The rest is undulating countryside. The soil is predominately chalk and was originally covered with beechwoods. Some of the trees have now been cleared; arable crops and pig rearing are the main types of land use. The area contains the hamlets of Swyncombe, Cookley Green and Russells Water and the farming communities at Greenfield and Lower Greenfield. In total the number of houses is about 3-400. At Swyncombe most people are connected with the estate. Some of the population of the area work in nearby towns or London.
